conclusion: The problem involves a detector moving along the positive direction of the x-axis with a velocity inversely proportional to its displacement.
The velocity \\( v \\) is inversely proportional to the displacement \\( x \\), expressed as \\( v = \frac{k}{x} \\).
The constant \\( k \\) is determined using the velocity at point B: \\( k = 4 \\).
The displacement at point A is calculated as \\( x_A = 1 \\) m.
The time taken to move from point A to point B is calculated by integrating the velocity with respect to displacement.
The integral evaluates to \\( t = 0.375 \\) seconds.
The time it takes for the detector to move from point A to point B is \\( oxed{0.375}\\) seconds.
